loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: This reinforcing loop accelerates team growth as more core developers provide mentorship, directly increasing the promotion rate of new members into the core team.
citation_title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach
citation_relevance: Examines how socialization processes including mentoring accelerate the integration of newcomers into core teams in OSS projects

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Skill up -> Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: This virtuous cycle amplifies team capability as mentorship builds contributor skills and experience, creating a larger, more qualified pipeline for core developer promotion.
citation_title: The social structure of free and open source software development
citation_relevance: Analyzes how skill development through community participation creates qualified contributor pools for core team roles

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Developer's Turnover -> Core Developer
description: This balancing loop stabilizes team size by limiting growth; as the core team expands, turnover increases, naturally counteracting further expansion.

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Skill up -> New Contributors -> Skill up -> Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: This balancing loop creates a delayed constraint on growth; while mentorship builds skills, it initially increases the contributor pool, creating a longer, more competitive path to core developer status.
